column4: is there a place to see all the packages that come with ubbuntu 6.10
check packages.ubuntu.com
will it tell the packages that come on 6.10 iso/cd
I'm not sure, but I think the package labels will tell you - if it doesn't say universe or multiverse, it's probably on the CD
ty

reson i need to know is b/c i have to use ppp b/c i have internet through my pc from phone, so i figure i should be able to cp the configs and put them in ubuntu if the ppp is installed by default, do u know if pppconfigs go in /etc/ppp like other distros
I can't say, but my understanding is that ppp is not installed by default (a lot of people have complained about this in previous releases)
well according to that page, kppp isn't in universe or the other one, so if it comes with kppp then it has to have ppp installed
could be - I've just heard of people installing and not being able to dial
well atm i am on gentoo and it is working from the config i have setup
if it has ppp base installed then i should be able to just put the config there and i am done
ppp (2.4.4rel-1ubuntu1) doesn't have universe/multiverse beside it
so logically I think you're right - I've just been looking through the forums to see if anyone has reported problems but haven't found anything. So I think you should be good.
i wish to help out by packaging programs, do u know of a easy way to
I'd check under http://www.ubuntu.com/community and see if you can find anything there
thx for all ur help
not sure I was all that useful, but no problem!
better than nothing, i atleast like talking to ppl that do try and help
better to try than not
that's one of the reasons I like the ubuntu community
i used ubuntu, hoary but i hear ppl talk about edgy
there have been three ubuntu versions released since hoary - edgy is the latest was released last week (check the links in /topic)
i know, just saying it's been a while
gotcha
